current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide stronger penalties for violations of the
		  Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Protecting Communities from Chemical
			 Explosions Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 550(d) of
			 the Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2007/s:550/ss:d

header.#text:
Civil and criminal
			 penalties for violations of Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism
			 Standards

text.#text:
by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be liable for a civil penalty under

text.#text:
Any owner or operator of a chemical
				facility that holds a quantity of a chemical of interest that is at or above
				the screening threshold quantity established under the interim final
				regulations issued under this section and that does not file a Chemical
				Security Assessment Tool Top-Screen with the

It shall be unlawful
				for an officer of an entity that owns or operates, or an owner or operator of,
				a chemical facility that holds a quantity of a chemical of interest that is at
				or above the screening threshold quantity established under the interim final
				regulations issued under this section to intentionally fail to file a Chemical
				Security Assessment Tool Top-Screen with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act, 2007/s:550/ss:d/p:3/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, imprisoned for not more
				than 6 years, or
				both.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S814 IS: Protecting Communities from Chemical Explosions Act of 2013
